name: Copper(I) iodide
desc: Copper(I) iodide is the inorganic compound with the formula CuI. It is also known as cuprous iodide. It is useful in a variety of applications ranging from organic synthesis to cloud seeding.
Appearance:
White powder
when impure: tan or brownish
Solubility:
soluble in ammonia and potassium solutions
insoluble in dilute acids
Other anions:
Copper(I) fluoride
Copper(I) chloride
Copper(I) bromide
standard state:
Except where otherwise noted, data are given for materials in their standard state (at 25 °C [77 °F], 100 kPa).
